about.title: About the Project
about.text: This app is a Slack clone that revolutionizes team communication and collaboration through an intuitive user interface, real-time messaging, and structured channel organization.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How do I keep my code clean and maintainable? I divided the project into reusable modules and components, focusing on documentation, consistent naming for files, variables, and classes, as well as thorough testing.

team.title: My Experience in Teamwork
team.text: The team consisted of several members. My responsibilities included the login form, dashboard, and chat functionality, among others. We used various technologies, and the positive collaboration within the team was a standout feature.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: El Pollo Loco is a browser-based jump 'n' run game created with HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript (ES6+), without using any frameworks. Pepe, the hero of the game, moves through the level collecting coins and bottles. He must avoid crazy chickens and chicks by jumping. The collected bottles are used to throw at the final boss, hopefully defeating him.

process.title: Technical Foundations
process.text: The game world and all objects (characters, background, enemies) were rendered using the Canvas API. Movements and collisions were implemented using requestAnimationFrame or setInterval. The game was also designed to be playable on smaller screens.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: This web application offers an interactive Pokédex experience. Users can search for Pokémon, view details with a click, and navigate through the Pokémon list. The design is visually inspired by the typical Pokémon style, featuring a responsive layout and an overlay for detailed views.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: I structure my projects into reusable modules and components to ensure clarity and scalability. For me, clean code is achieved through clear naming conventions, documentation, and targeted tests.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: This platform is the result of a comprehensive relaunch for CCN Removals. In addition to modernizing the design, the focus was on functionality: the website should not only inform but also serve as an interactive tool. By implementing a moving goods calculator, the website was upgraded from a purely informational site to a real service tool for the end customer. The platform is now not only visually appealing but also intuitive to use and offers clear guidance for customers.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How do I integrate complex functions in a user-friendly way? The focus was on developing an intuitive user interface (UI), especially for the calculator. I organized the process so that technical features are seamlessly embedded into the design. Through consistency in design and clear call-to-action areas, the user is logically guided through the inquiry processes. I also paid attention to maintainability so that price structures in the calculator can be easily adjusted by the client.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: This project was a complete relaunch for the company Falke Facility Management. The goal was to reposition the service offering through a contemporary design and a clear information architecture. The website now serves as a digital business card that radiates professionalism and trust, directly addressing potential customers through structured user guidance.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How do I combine technical performance with high-quality content? Since images and videos were specially produced for this project, a special focus was placed on integrating this media without negatively affecting the website's loading times. I structured the site's layout to create a perfect balance between visual elements and informational texts. Clean code and optimized media assets ensure that the site runs smoothly and performs well on all devices.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: This project is a comprehensive redesign and relaunch for the company 'Die Fliese Living'. The goal was to transform the web presence from a purely informative, text-heavy site into a modern, visual experience. The focus is now on the aesthetic presentation of materials: a fresh screen design puts the products in the spotlight and inspires the user with high-quality project examples.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How do I ensure that design and technology harmonize? I managed the project holistically – from the initial screen design to the technical implementation in WordPress. I divided the project management into clear phases: conception, design draft, and development. To ensure the site's maintainability, I focused on a clean structuring of the WordPress installation, performed image optimizations for performance (important for the galleries' loading times), and set up an intuitive backend for the client.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: The client wanted a contemporary design for their website that avoids excessive effects. Therefore, I worked with subtle transitions and established the logo as a stylistic element.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How do I ensure that design and technology harmonize? I managed the project holistically – from the initial screen design to the technical implementation in WordPress. I divided the project management into clear phases: conception, design draft, and development. To ensure the site's maintainability, I focused on a clean structuring of the WordPress installation, performed image optimizations for performance (important for the galleries' loading times), and set up an intuitive backend for the client.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: For the F. Arthur Uebel brand, the outdated website was comprehensively revised to create a modern image site. The new website was intended to clearly highlight the clarinets and artists to present the brand image more strongly and emotionally. The implementation was based on WordPress and WooCommerce to ensure flexibility, scalability, and easy maintenance of the platform. The project included not only the design but also the complete implementation and support from the initial consultation to the live launch.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How can an image site be both emotional and functional? The focus was on creating a clear, visual structure that centers on the clarinets and artists of the F. Arthur Uebel brand. I organized the process so that the design and technical implementation were seamlessly coordinated. Through emotional imagery, clear navigation, and an intuitive e-commerce area, the user experience was optimized. I also paid special attention to consistency in design and the platform's maintainability to allow for future adjustments by the operator.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: In the Q-Chess Mobile project, I modernized the user interface design and the user experience to bring it up-to-date. The app was completely redesigned from scratch and tailored specifically to the client’s needs.

process.title: How I Organized My Work Process
process.text: First, I conducted an assessment of the current state to then define clear, measurable goals. In the next step, I focused on reorganizing user guidance and optimizing usability.

about.title: About the Project
about.text: For the Widmann Germany brand, the outdated website was comprehensively revised to create a modern image site with an integrated shop function. The new website focused on clearly highlighting the products while conveying more emotion and a stronger brand identity. The implementation was based on Shopware to ensure flexibility and scalability for future requirements. The project included not only the design but also the complete implementation and support from the initial consultation to the live launch.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How can a website be both emotional and functional? The focus was on creating a clear, visually appealing website with a product focus that strengthens both e-commerce functions and the brand image. I organized the process so that the design and technical implementation were seamlessly coordinated. Through a clear structure, emotional imagery, and an intuitive ordering process, the user experience was optimized. I also paid special attention to consistency in design and the platform's maintainability to allow for future adjustments by the operator.

haendlerbackend.title: Dealer Backend for the Bruchköbel Marketplace

about.title: About the Project
about.text: The dealer backend for the Bruchköbel city marketplace was revitalized with a facelift and a revised user experience to become more attractive to local businesses. The goal was to design the platform in such a way that more dealers from the region would want to present themselves on the marketplace. In addition to the visual modernization, the focus was on improving usability to enable users to work more easily and efficiently.

process.title: How I Organized My Workflow
process.text: How can a dealer backend be designed to be intuitive and user-friendly? The focus was on developing a clear user interface (UI) that is easy for dealers to understand and efficient in daily use. I organized the process so that technical features like forms or data processing are seamlessly embedded into the design. Through consistent design elements and clear actions (e.g., 'Save', 'Reset'), the user is logically guided through the application processes. I also paid attention to maintainability so that future adjustments to the platform by the operator remain possible.
